alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 11:01PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Natrona County through 1130 PM MDT... At 1100 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Goldeneye Reservoir to 9 miles northeast of Evansville. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain cause cause minor flooding. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Natrona County, including the following locations... Edness K Wilkins State Park, Casper Natural Gas Processing Plant, Casper Events Center and Casper-Natrona County International Airport. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 176 and 187, and between mile markers 190 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
